title: A new graphic novel takes aim at Iran’s oppressive government
subtitle: The author of “Persepolis” returns with a riveting collection of illustrated stories

contents.text: Woman, Life, Freedom. By Marjane Satrapi. Translated by Una Dimitrijevic. Seven Stories Press; 280 pages; $35.95 and £30

Covering the mêlée of missiles exchanged between Iran and Israel in April, many newspapers, including this one, used a similar photograph. It was of a woman wearing a hijab and walking past a mural depicting Iranian rockets. The choice summed up the things for which Iran’s thuggish theocracy is best known: sabre-rattling and controlling women.
